com.nimbusds.openid.connect.http
Class HTTPResponse

java.lang.Object
  com.nimbusds.openid.connect.http.HTTPResponse

public class HTTPResponse
extends java.lang.Object

HTTP response with support for all parameters required to construct an OpenID Connect response message.

Version:
0.9 (2012-05-11)
Author:
Vladimir Dzhuvinov

Field Summary
static int SC_BAD_REQUEST
          HTTP status code (400) indicating a bad request.

          HTTP status code (403) indicating that access to the resource was forbidden.

          HTTP status code (302) indicating that the resource reside temporarily under a different URI (redirect).
static int SC_OK
          HTTP status code (200) indicating the request succeeded normally.
static int SC_UNAUTHORIZED
          HTTP status code (401) indicating that the request requires HTTP authentication.

ensureContentType

public void ensureContentType(javax.mail.internet.ContentType contentType)
                       throws ParseException
Ensures this HTTP response has the specified Content-Type header value. Note that this method compares only the primary type and subtype; any content type parameters, such as charset, are ignored.

Parameters:
contentType - The expected content type. Must not be null.
Throws:
ParseException - If the Content-Type header is missing or its primary and subtype doesn't match.

apply

public void apply(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse sr)
           throws java.io.IOException
Applies the status code, headers and content of this HTTP response object to the specified HTTP servlet response.

Parameters:
sr - The HTTP servlet response to apply. Must not be null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the response content couldn't be written.
